de.jannlab

Interface Net

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BidirectionalNetBase, FeedForwardNetBase, NetBase, OfflineRecurrentNetBase, OnlineRecurrentNetBase, RecurrentNetBase

    public interface Net
extends Serializable
    This interfaces represents neural networks in this framework. All ANN implementations are subclass of Net. The provided methods are for reading and writing data from and into the network, for computing and moving through the time (for recurrent networks).

    Author:
    Sebastian Otte

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        void reset()
        Resets the network, which means that all inner states (activations, derivations) are set to 0.0. The method also resets the time index which is 0 after doing reset.

      • initializeWeights

        void initializeWeights()
        Initialize weights randomly.

      • initializeWeights

        void initializeWeights(Random rnd)
        Initialize weights randomly with a given Random instance.

        Parameters:
        rnd - Instance of Random.

      • input

        void input(double[] data,
         int offset)
        Copies data to the input layer of the network. This method depends on the the current time step.

        Parameters:
        data - Source data buffer
        offset - Offset in the source data buffer.

      • input

        void input(double[] data,
         int offset,
         int[] selection)
        Copies data to the input layer of the network only for a given selection. This method depends on the the current time step.

        Parameters:
        data - Source data buffer
        offset - Offset in the source data buffer.
        selection - A selection given as array of indices.

      • output

        void output(double[] data,
          int offset)
        Copies data from the outputlayer of the network into a given data buffer. This method depends on the the current time step.
        Parameters:
        data - Destination data buffer.
        offset - Offset in the destination data buffer.

      • output

        void output(double[] data,
          int offset,
          int[] selection)
        Copies data from the outputlayer of the network into a given data buffer only for a given selection. This method depends on the the current time step.
        Parameters:
        data - Destination data buffer.
        offset - Offset in the destination data buffer.
        selection - A selection given as array of indices.

      • target

        void target(double[] data,
          int offset)
        Copies data to the output layer of the network (the target output). This method depends on the the current time step.

        Parameters:
        data - Source data buffer
        offset - Offset in the source data buffer.

      • target

        void target(double[] data,
          int offset,
          int[] selection)
        Copies data to the output layer of the network (the target output) for a given selection. This method depends on the the current time step.

        Parameters:
        data - Source data buffer.
        offset - Offset in the source data buffer.
        selection - A selection given as array of indices.

      • error

        double error()
        Computes the error of the outputlayer, based on the current outputlayer activation and the injected target output. This method depends on the the current time step.

        Returns:
        The current output array.

      • inputPort

        WritePort inputPort()
        Returns a WritePort for writing into the inputlayer.

        Returns:
        Instance of WritePort.

      • outputPort

        ReadPort outputPort()
        Returns a ReadPort for reading data from the outputlayer.
        Returns:
        Instance of ReadPort.

      • targetPort

        WritePort targetPort()
        Returns a WritePort for writing data into the outputlayer (the target output).
        Returns:
        Instance of WritePort.

      • copy

        Net copy()
        Copies the entire network instance. This performs a deep copy.
        Returns:
        Deep copy of this instance.

      • sharedCopy

        Net sharedCopy()
        Performs a shared copy of the network instance. Some data part such a links, weights etc. are shared. The rest (data buffers) are private. The shared copy provides parallel computation with the "same" network.
        Returns:
        Shared copy of this instance.

      • compute

        void compute()
        Computes the activation of the network. The method strongly depends on the underlying network implementation (online vs. offline).

      • computeGradient

        void computeGradient()
        Computes the gradient (error flow) of the network. The method strongly depends on the underlying network implementation (online vs. offline).

      • incrFrameIdx

        void incrFrameIdx()
        Increases the current frame index (time index).

      • setFrameIdx

        void setFrameIdx(int idx)
        Sets the current frame index (time index) to the given value.

        Parameters:
        idx - The new time index.

      • getFrameWidth

        int getFrameWidth()
        Get the frame width of the network.
        Returns:
        Frame width of this instance.

      • getFrameIdx

        int getFrameIdx()
        Return the current frame index (time index).
        Returns:
        Current frame index (time index).

      • decrFrameIdx

        void decrFrameIdx()
        Decreases the current frame index (time index).

      • getOutputBuffer

        double[] getOutputBuffer(int frameidx)
        Gives the internal output buffer for a given frame index (time index).

        Parameters:
        frameidx - The requested frame idx (time index).
        Returns:
        Output data buffer for frame idx (time index).

      • getGradOutputBuffer

        double[] getGradOutputBuffer(int frameidx)
        Gives the internal gradient output buffer for a given frame index (time index).

        Parameters:
        frameidx - The requested frame idx (time index).
        Returns:
        Gradient output data buffer for frame idx (time index).

      • getGradInputBuffer

        double[] getGradInputBuffer(int frameidx)
        Gives the internal gradient input buffer for a given frame index (time index).

        Parameters:
        frameidx - The requested frame idx (time index).
        Returns:
        Gradient input buffer for frame idx (time index).

      • isRecurrent

        boolean isRecurrent()
        Returns true if the network has recurrent connections, false otherwise.

      • isOnline

        boolean isOnline()
        Returns true if the network computes online, false otherwise.

      • isBidirectional

        boolean isBidirectional()
        Return true is the network is bidirectional, false otherwise.

      • isOffline

        boolean isOffline()
        Returns true if the network computes offline, false otherwise.

      • getInputCells

        int getInputCells()
        Returns the number of input cells.

      • getOutputCells

        int getOutputCells()
        Returns the number of output cells.

      • getValueCells

        int getValueCells()
        Returns the number of values cells.

      • getComputingCells

        int getComputingCells()
        Returns the number of computing cells.

      • getWeights

        double[] getWeights()
        Returns the current weight vector. Note that the first weight of the vector is still 1.0.

      • getWeightsNum

        int getWeightsNum()
        Returns the number of weights. Note that the first weight of the vector is still 1.0. The weight is not counted by this method.

      • writeWeights

        void writeWeights(double[] data,
                int offset)
        Writes the given values into the internal weight buffer.
        Parameters:
        data - Reference to the source double array.
        offset - Gives an offset of the weights within the data array.

      • readWeights

        void readWeights(double[] data,
               int offset)
        Copies the weights from the internal weight buffer into the given array.
        Parameters:
        data - Reference to the target double array.
        offset - Gives an offset for the target array.

      • getLinks

        int[] getLinks()
        Returns the forward links. The links are optimized for the forward pass.

      • getLinksRev

        int[] getLinksRev()
        Returns the backward links. The links are optimized for the backward pass.

      • getLinksNum

        int getLinksNum()
        Returns the number of links, which can be bigger than the number of weights.

      • rebuffer

        void rebuffer(int frames)
        Rebuffers (reallocates) the internal data buffers.
        Parameters:
        frames - The number of time steps provided by the network.

      • numericalCheck

        boolean numericalCheck()
        Performs a numerical check for debugging the framework. Return false if at least one value is NaN or Infinity.

      • getStructure

        NetStructure getStructure()
        Returns the NetStructure instance of the current network.

        Warning: The variables of the instance are all public accessible. Changing them may affect the inner consistency of the network.
